sentence: Consumer stocks rose moderately Thursday, with shares of consumer staples companies in the S&P 500 posting a 0.4% gain while shares of consumer discretionary companies in the S&P 500 added about 0.6%.

In company news, Alon Blue Square Israel Ltd ( BSI ) rebounded Thursday following a favorable court order today that barred further legal actions against a 51%-owned subsidiary of the struggling retailing company before another court hearing scheduled for next week.

Today's district court decision in Lod, Israel, temporarily stays further proceedings against the Alon Blue Square indirect unit, Eden Briut Teva Market Ltd., as well as a related entity, the Mega Retail supermarket chain, until the July 14 hearing on Eden's repayment proposals.
The court also appointed a trustee for Eden during the stay period.
Overall, Eden owes around $21.3 million (80.8 million shekels) to creditors in addition to another $19.8 million in bank debt guaranteed by Mega and Alon.
It also owes Mega around $26.7 million in shareholder loans.
BSI shares were up almost 16% at $1.89 each this afternoon, earlier climbing to a session high of $1.96 a share.
Over the past 12 months, the stock had dropped almost 48% through yesterday's close.
(+) CRV, Agrees to $29 mln buyout proposal from LKQ Corp ( LKQ ), which will pay $5.50 per share in cash for the auto-parts wholesaler.
